On August 22, 2025, Wipro Limited announced its acquisition of the Digital Transformation Solutions (DTS) business unit from Harman International, a Samsung company .

Strategic acquisition:The deal, valued at $375 million, will see Wipro gain full ownership of Harman's DTS unit.

Enhanced capabilities:The acquisition is intended to accelerate Wipro's Engineering Research and Development (ER&D) services. It will strengthen capabilities in AI-powered digital engineering, device engineering, and design-to-manufacturing solutions across various sectors, including technology, aerospace, healthcare, and consumer industries.

Multi-year partnership:As part of the agreement, Wipro will also enter a multi-year strategic collaboration with Harman and Samsung.

Significant employee transfer:Over 5,600 DTS employees across the Americas, Europe, and Asia will transition to Wipro.

Positive analyst outlook:Some market analysts see the acquisition as a long-term positive for Wipro, anticipating a boost in revenue growth and an expansion of its client base. However, others are more cautious due to potential near-term pressure on margins from integration costs.
